a.bubble: The <a> tag (or "anchor element"), with its href attribute, can be used to create hyperlinks to other web pages, files, email addresses, another location in the same page or anything else a URL can point to.
a.example: further down back to top home page home page call Tommy Tutone say hello! download

audio.example:
<!-- simple example -->
<audio src="audios/katy.mp3" controls></audio>

<!-- specifying different types -->
<!-- the browser will choose the version it can support -->
<audio controls>
  <source src="audios/katy.mp3" type="audio/mpeg">
  <source src="audios/katy.ogg" type="audio/ogg">
</audio>

br.example:
CLOUD PIECE
by Yoko Ono

Imagine the clouds dripping.
Dig a hole in your garden to
put them in.

1963 spring

datalist.bubble: Used in combintion with the <input> and <option> elements, the <datalist> element is used to create a text field with auto-suggestions (based on it's <option> elements) that drop down as the user types into it.
datalist.example:
<!-- text field with auto-suggestions -->
<input list="ice-cream-flavors" placeholder="ice-cream flavor">
<datalist id="ice-cream-flavors">
  <option value="Chocolate"></option>
  <option value="Coconut"></option>
  <option value="Mint"></option>
  <option value="Strawberry"></option>
  <option value="Vanilla"></option>
</datalist>

img.bubble: The <img> element is used to embed an image. As a "singleton" or "void element" it does not have a closing tag. It does, however, require at least one html attribute, the src attribute: <img src="path/to/file.jpg">

input.example:
<!-- a text field -->
<input type="text" placeholder="your username">
<!-- a password field -->
<input type="password" placeholder="secret password">
<!-- color selector -->
<input type="color">
<!-- slider -->
<input type="range">
<!-- a radio button -->
<input type="radio">
<!-- a check box -->
<input type="checkbox" checked="true">
<!-- click the link at the top or bottom of this reference for more examples -->

link.example:
<!-- importing a CSS stylesheet -->
<link href="path/to/styles.css" rel="stylesheet">
<!-- adding a favicon (appears in browser tab) to a page -->
<link rel="icon" href="favicon.ico">
<!-- adding icon for mobile apps -->
<link rel="apple-touch-icon" href="icon.png">
<!-- preloading fonts -->
<link rel="preload" href="myFont.woff2" as="font" type="font/woff2" crossorigin="anonymous">
<!-- to learn more about "preloading" assets see: -->
<!-- https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Link_types/preload -->

option.bubble: As the name implies, the <option> element is used to define a selectable item in a <select> (dropdown menu) or <datalist> (auto-suggestion search field) element.
option.example:
<!-- text field with auto-suggestions -->
<input list="ice-cream-flavors" placeholder="ice-cream flavor">
<datalist id="ice-cream-flavors">
  <option value="Chocolate"></option>
  <option value="Coconut"></option>
  <option value="Mint"></option>
  <option value="Strawberry"></option>
  <option value="Vanilla"></option>
</datalist>

<!-- a drop-down list -->
<select id="pet-select">
  <option value="">--Please choose a pet--</option>
  <option value="dog">Dog</option>
  <option value="cat">Cat</option>
  <option value="hamster">Hamster</option>
  <option value="parrot">Parrot</option>
  <option value="spider">Spider</option>
  <option value="goldfish">Goldfish</option>
</select>

ol.example:
Four basic kinds of straight lines:
  1. Vertical
  2. Horizontal
  3. Diagonal l. to r.
  4. Diagonal r. to l.
and their combinations.

ul.example:
Four basic kinds of straight lines:
  • Vertical
  • Horizontal
  • Diagonal l. to r.
  • Diagonal r. to l.
and their combinations.

li.example:
Four basic kinds of straight lines:
  1. Vertical
  2. Horizontal
  3. Diagonal l. to r.
  4. Diagonal r. to l.
and their combinations.

select.bubble: Used in combintion with the <option> element, the <select> element is used to create a dropdown menu.
select.example:
<!-- a drop-down list -->
<select id="pet-select">
  <option value="">--Please choose a pet--</option>
  <option value="dog">Dog</option>
  <option value="cat">Cat</option>
  <option value="hamster">Hamster</option>
  <option value="parrot">Parrot</option>
  <option value="spider">Spider</option>
  <option value="goldfish">Goldfish</option>
</select>

source.bubble: The <source> element specifies multiple media resources for it's parent element, for example <picture>, <video> and <audio>. It is commonly used to offer the same media content in multiple file formats in order to provide compatibility with a broad range of browsers given their differing support for image file formats and media file formats.
source.example:
<video controls>
  <source src="videos/screen-saver.mp4" type="video/mp4">
  <source src="videos/screen-saver.webm" type="video/webm">
  <source src="videos/screen-saver.ogv" type="video/ogg">
</video>

<audio controls>
  <source src="audios/katy.mp3" type="audio/mpeg">
  <source src="audios/katy.ogg" type="audio/ogg">
</audio>

video.example:
<!-- video with controls present -->
<video src="videos/screen-saver.mp4" controls>

<!-- specifying different types -->
<!-- the browser will choose the version it can support -->
<video controls>
  <source src="videos/screen-saver.mp4" type="video/mp4">
  <source src="videos/screen-saver.webm" type="video/webm">
  <source src="videos/screen-saver.ogv" type="video/ogg">
</video>

href.bubble: The href attribute is used to create a hyperlink to another reference (resource, file, page, etc), by assigning a URL as it's value. This can be an absolute/relative URL or any other URL scheme supported by browsers. Check out more examples in the <a> reference page.
href.example: home page about us more info below

target.example: home page

type.bubble: The type attribute is used to change the default type of elements like <input> and <source> which can have different control, media or other types.
type.exmaple:
<!-- different "types" of inputs -->
<input type="text" placeholder="your username">
<!-- slider -->
<input type="range">
<!-- color selector -->
<input type="color">

<!-- different "types" of videos -->
<video controls>
  <source src="videos/screen-saver.mp4" type="video/mp4">
  <source src="videos/screen-saver.webm" type="video/webm">
  <source src="videos/screen-saver.ogv" type="video/ogg">
</video>
